alert.note: Alert for Creek; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Osage; Pawnee; Rogers; Tulsa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 02 at 6:56PM CDT until May 02 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... West central Rogers County in northeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern Osage County in northeastern Oklahoma... Creek County in northeastern Oklahoma... Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern Pawnee County in northeastern Oklahoma... Tulsa County in northeastern Oklahoma... Okfuskee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 745 PM CDT. * At 656 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles west of Mannford to 6 miles east of Sparks, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Sand Springs... Okmulgee... Bristow... Okemah... Owasso... Bixby... Sapulpa... Jenks... Okfuskee... Glenpool... Catoosa... Henryetta... Mannford... Drumright... Kiefer... Morris... Beggs... Sperry... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 217 and 243. Interstate 44 between mile markers 177 and 234. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Creek; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Osage; Pawnee; Rogers; Tulsa
